comment: It took two months to do one project. With no direction or due date. The last two projects where a nightmare. She never ordered the materials on time and didn't order enough for everyone. And ended up with myself and another student having to pay her almost 200 dollars because she told us the wrong math for the ounces of pewter we needed.

I felt a huge discrepancy between what was "taught" by Ms Sarmiento and what she expected from us. I would normally complain about a professor who doesn't show up on time, but Ms Sarmiento added so little to the course that it literally made no difference. My crux was her inability to give straightforward answers to straightforward questions. AVOID
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I... I can find even find the words to describe her. She's just so unique where you can't understand unless you take her. She always tells you do something one way then two minutes another way and then later go back to the first way etc. the color theory part of her class is awful because you get a project every class and due the next class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Hands down the worst teacher I can remember having. Rude, SO RUDE, like someone else said, condescending, terrible at organization, springs things on you, won't listen to your ideas, hidden costs of materials that also get sprung on you. I cannot stand this woman, do yourself a favor like others have said and STEER CLEAR! ANYONE BUT HER.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: THIS TEACHER IS TERRIBLE. PLEASE DON'T DO IT TO YOURSELF! only 3 assignments. I have spent over 150$ on materials for the class. she is so rude too. like so rude.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: very confusing professor... for some reason she gives u like 2-3 weeks to do the first couple of projects so then by the last month of the semester which is the color theory part, u are having a project assigned and due the next class period. very unprofessional, always late and can be sassy at times. I recommend a different professor
first two months is relaxed but in the couple weeks of class you have 6 assignments, 4 projects 2 tests and the final. do I need to say more.....

the 2d design part of class is fine you get like two weeks to do an assignment. However once you are done with that part of the class you have one month left and when you look at d2l you are like "how do we have 7 assignments left, 4 projects, 2 tests and a final exam left"? you think "oh she will probably just not do some of these then.... nope

Professor Sarmiento is nice, but probably the most unorganized teacher I have ever had. She has no course schedule, the information and grading criteria is extremely unorganized and unclear. She will tell you to do one thing, and tell your neighbor another. She is also SUPER unclear about due dates. Sweet lady, but not a good teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Ive never had more of a confusing professor in my life. she will tell you to do one thing and then 30 mintues later tell you that you cant do that. she Is kind but very confusing. Accent is not a problem at all like people are saying. She is just very confusing. I don't recommend her honestly because she gives too much work in the time you have

Professor Sarmiento is  sweet but really disorganized. Quizzes are kinda sprung on you and lots of stuff is just decided on a whim. That being said, it's pretty easy to pass. the first project was a BEAST but as long as you show up to class and make the most of the in class time, its pretty easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: It's a pretty easy class, some people didn't like her as a teacher. It's basically just come to class, work on your assignment and finish it by the due date and you get an A. Even if you are awful at design, as long as you follow her rubric you get an A. And her final exam was only 25 questions and she gave us the flashcards on quizlet to study.

She was confusing to understand because she isn't always clear with directions. Often impatient with students who are having difficulty. When you come to her with direct straight-forward questions, she'll answer them. Easy to get 100s on assignments, just follow the rubric and it's easy. Not the sweetest, but she's doable.

She really is the sweetest person, just disorganized. It's not hard to get a high grade, just produce the work required. On a personal level, she is the nicest and most understanding. Give her a chance...what can you lose...creativity? Only real complaint is watch your time.

The woman is sincere. With that being said, she gave a 'B' to a project consisting of a serial plane tornado crashing into a bird house with farm animals hanging off from it by fishing wire [tacky, I know]. I got a 'C' in the class because I'm lazy. [A+'s on projects, but pretty much failed tests/quizes because I took an art class, not an English.]

Please, everyone that read the positive comment below ask yourself this. If she was such a great teacher than why is ever other comment negative? Plus she teaches at AI or SCAD and if youlook her up she will have a lot of negative comments.Its not a coincidence. This is coming from an Honors student with a 4.0 GPA and multiple scholarships for art

Avoid this teacher if you can. She limits your creative ability a great deal unless she actually likes you. She hardly covers exam materials except for a few powerpoints she mumbles through. Her projects are boring compared to what you will see the other classes do. Overall you will leave that class having learned nothing at all

This is going to sound crazy, but don't listen to any of those other people rating Mrs. Sarmiento. She's actually really nice and she makes jokes, she always does a demo before a new project, she notifies you about when the shop is going to be open, and about good deals she found on supplies. I promise that Mrs. Sarmiento is a fun and fair teacher.

Unless you want to be treated like a middle school student and have a teacher who will insult you, I would steer clear of this shipwreck. Is completely unable to do even what I would say to be a satisfactory job.

She is by far one of the worst teachers I've ever had at Kennesaw. If you're a fine arts major and want to truly learn anything about 3D or sculpture take another teacher. She very rude, comes in about 15 minutes late (which sounds great at first until you do and she counts you absent) and also is unclear about projects and their deadlines.

She limits those who are more creative. She does pick favorites out of the class and let them explore the creative side with no issue, everyone else has to suffer. Once you ask for help, you have to go with the idea she provided or your grade will show. My class as a whole went to Linda Hightower about this horrible teacher. Steer clear!!

She is very unclear in her directions and if you ask for more assistance, she'll probably say ask a classmate for help.  She piles on assignments and will give you notices the day you have class to do something.
No Comments
